DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim project determine clinical efficacy chiropractic Spinal Manipulative Therapy ( SMT ) plus self-care education versus self-care education alone 192 patient sub-acute chronic Back Related Leg Pain ( BRLP ) short-term ( 12 week ) long-term ( 52 week ) . The primary outcome variable leg pain secondary outcome variable include low back pain , disability , bothersomeness frequency symptom , general health status , fear avoidance behavior . Secondary aim describe estimate group difference patient satisfaction , improvement , medication use , straight leg raise , torso endurance , three biomechanical measure : continuous spinal motion , postural sway , neuromuscular response sudden load . Patient perception treatment also assess .
DOC.criteria: Backrelated leg pain > 3 0 10 scale . Subacute chronic backrelated leg pain define current episode > 4 week duration . Backrelated leg pain classify 2 , 3 , 4 , 6 use Quebec Task Force ( QTF ) Classification system . This include radiate pain proximal distal part lower extremity , without neurological sign , possible compression nerve root . 21 year age old . Stable prescription medication plan ( change prescription medication affect musculoskeletal pain previous month ) . Ongoing treatment leg low back pain health care provider . Progressive neurological deficit cauda equina syndrome . QTF classification 5 ( spinal fracture ) 11 ( diagnosis include visceral disease , compression fracture , metastasis ) . These serious condition amenable conservative treatment propose . QTF 7 ( spinal stenosis syndrome characterize pain and/or paresthesias one leg aggravate walk ) . Uncontrolled hypertension metabolic disease . Blood clot disorder . Severe osteoporosis . Inflammatory destructive tissue change spine . Patients surgical lumbar spine fusion patient multiple incident lumbar surgery . This subgroup low back pain patient generally poorer prognosis . Pregnant nursing woman . Current pending litigation . Patients seek financial compensation tend respond differently treatment .
